page.title: 02HISTORY OF THE SCHOOL
page.content: The school was opened in St Erme in 1878 following the 1870 education act. Four years later a small extention was added as there was know_where for them to hang and dry their coats.At the opening there were fifty children on roll.It was common for children to bring pasties to school for their dinner.These would be placed on top of the coal burning stove to be heated during the morning. The numbers in school varied but by the middle 1970's had dropped below 30.Then some development began and numbers rose.In 1980 a mobile classroom was added,to be followed by another in 1983.The following year a field was purchased as the site of a new school,but cut backs in spending mean this will not be built in the near future.A mobile office was added in 1985.The roll will soon excede 100.
